pinyin: e4 xing4 tong1 huo4 peng2 zhang4

sentences.english: It's a classic case of cost-push inflation.
sentences.chinese: 這是典型的成本推動的通貨膨脹。

sentences.english: Trouble develops, however, when any human instinct or appetite causes overdeveloped.
sentences.chinese: 但假使人的欲求或喜好過度膨脹則會帶來麻煩。

sentences.english: That uncertain thing was swelled bigger.
sentences.chinese: 那個不知叫什麼的東西膨脹得更大了。

sentences.english: The rate of inflations has increased by 2%.
We can just say religion excess, why?
sentences.chinese: 我們可以就說這是宗教的膨脹，爲什麼呢？

sentences.english: Use percussive drill to enlarge holes. Install expansion plugs and secure with wood screws.
sentences.chinese: 直接塞上膨脹塞並用75MM的木螺釘固定。

sentences.english: The government’s full-year inflation target is 3 percent.
sentences.chinese: 中國政府全年的通貨膨脹率目標爲3%。

sentences.english: It is the collapsing of the Expander that triggers the Adorer clean up code.
sentences.chinese: 這是崩潰的膨脹觸發崇拜者清理代碼。

sentences.english: Steel and concrete have almost the same rate of contraction and expansion.
sentences.chinese: 鋼和混凝土有幾乎相同的收縮率和膨脹率。

sentences.english: Traditional schoolbook says inflation will cause devaluation.
sentences.chinese: 傳統的教科書說通貨膨脹將導致貨幣貶值。

sentences.english: NEW YORK (CNNMoney.com) -- It may be the world's last real estate bubble, one that is still inflating rapidly.
sentences.chinese: 這將是世界上依然在持續的泡沫，當然它還在膨脹。

sentences.english: The sword swallower swallowed a swollen sword.
sentences.chinese: 吞劍人吞了一把膨脹的劍。

sentences.english: The calculating formula used for the intumescent velocity was presented and was applied to the model proposed.
sentences.chinese: 用於膨脹速度的計算公式被提出並應用提出的模型。

sentences.english: This amount increases each year you're here in-line with inflation and subject to government regulations.
sentences.chinese: 這個數字每年會隨着通貨膨脹率變化而變化。

sentences.english: This kind of recognition has been growing in Asia.
sentences.chinese: 這種看法已經在亞洲膨脹起來。

definition: to pull back/to shrink/to contract/(physiology) systole
expansion/dilation/to expand (e.g. one's power or influence)/to broaden
to lead to/to create/to cause/to bring about
to intensify/to sharpen/to accelerate/to aggravate/to exacerbate/to embitter
to release/to set free/to liberate (a prisoner)/to discharge
